official-title.#text:
To provide Capitol-flown flags to the immediate family of
		  fire fighters, law enforcement officers, emergency medical technicians, and
		  other rescue workers who are killed in the line of duty.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Providing
			 capitol-flown flags for families of law enforcement and rescue workers killed
			 in the line of duty

text.#text:
At the request of the immediate family of a fire fighter,
			 law enforcement officer, emergency technician, or other rescue worker who died
			 in the line of duty, the Representative of the family may provide the family
			 with a Capitol-flown flag, together with the certificate described in

A flag provided under this section shall be provided at no
			 cost to the family.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and the Representative providing
			 the flag, and which contains an expression of sympathy from the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for the family involved, as prepared and developed by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Clerk
			 of the House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Clerk of the House of Representatives

text.#text:
The
			 certificate described in this subsection is a certificate which is signed by
			 the

term.#tail:
means a United States flag flown over the
			 United States Capitol in honor of the deceased individual for whom such flag is
			 requested; and
includes a Delegate or Resident Commissioner to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall issue regulations for carrying out this
			 Act, including regulations to establish procedures (including any appropriate
			 forms, guidelines, and accompanying certificates) for requesting a
			 Capitol-flown flag.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Clerk of the House of Representatives

text.#text:

			 enactment of this Act, the
